etymology.interpretation: Combines the person radical with 象, whose sound supplies the pronunciation and whose sense can suggest an image or likeness. Conveys ideas of a person’s likeness or representation, aligning with meanings like portrait or resemble.

examples.chinese: 他长得很像他父亲(他長得很像他父親)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǎng de hěn xiàng tā fùqīn.
examples.english: He looks a lot like his father.

examples.chinese: 这张照片很像他(這張照片很像他)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhāng zhàopiàn hěn xiàng tā.
examples.english: This photo looks very much like him.

examples.chinese: 博物馆里有孔子的铜像(博物館裡有孔子的銅像)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn lǐ yǒu Kǒngzǐ de tóngxiàng.
examples.english: The museum has a bronze statue of Confucius.
